cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island and 110 mi ENE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to track northwest just off the Florida east coast today–Wednesday, then turn north and north-northeast and move very near the Georgia–South Carolina coasts late Wednesday–Thursday, passing close to or over the North Carolina coast late Thursday before continuing offshore toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or on the North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from north of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC; Tropical Storm Watch north of Golden Beach FL to Deerfield Beach FL and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Lantana FL to Savannah River; Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Tropical Storm Warning north of Deerfield Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through the Carolinas with eventual influence along the Mid-Atlantic coast including Virginia
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (potential 2–4 ft inundation along lower Chesapeake Bay/coastal VA if track is close)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible; cumulative 34 % chance of ≥34 kt and 8 % chance of ≥50 kt at Norfolk within 5 days, beginning late Thursday–Friday with gusts possibly approaching hurricane force in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Moderate coastal flooding of 2–4 ft above ground possible around tidal peaks Friday, especially in the lower Chesapeake Bay and along exposed Atlantic inlets.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 2–4 in (isolated 6 in) Thursday night–Friday causing localized flash flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning mid-week; risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands as the cyclone passes.
